definition: all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend

sentences.english: The country was torn apart by fierce intertribal hostilities.
sentences.chinese: 種族間的激烈衝突把這個國家弄得四分五裂。

sentences.english: Last night a bomb ripped apart the train in which we had been travelling.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜裏一顆炸彈將我們乘坐的火車炸得四分五裂。

sentences.english: The plane would probably disintegrate at that high speed.
sentences.chinese: 飛機以那麼高速飛行也許會四分五裂。

sentences.english: And sometimes, like now, they tear the state apart.
sentences.chinese: 有時，就在此時，他們把國家撕得四分五裂。

sentences.english: By then, however, the band was splintering up, never to regain its momentum. DH
sentences.chinese: 然而，到那時樂隊正四分五裂，且從未重整旗鼓。

sentences.english: Under stress, this time, Europe did not splinter.
sentences.chinese: 此次，重壓之下的歐洲並未出現四分五裂的局面。

sentences.english: The party has also become more riven by factionalism than ever.
sentences.chinese: 該黨也因派系鬥爭比以往更四分五裂。

sentences.english: When that thing falls apart, you go back to the parts.
sentences.chinese: 當它四分五裂的時候，就會回到原來的那些部分。

sentences.english: The country was torn apart by fierce tribal hostilities.
sentences.chinese: 那個國家被部落間的激烈衝突弄得四分五裂。

sentences.english: The roads were torn apart and blocked at points by collapsed inns.
sentences.chinese: 路面四分五裂，倒塌了的旅館的碎片橫在了路中央。

sentences.english: Two more marines went up, and the minaret began to come apart.
sentences.chinese: 兩個美軍上去了，塔開始四分五裂。

definition: to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
loudly/with a loud bang/a loud rumble
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
